leukapp.apps.extractions.factories module¶

Testing factories for the extractions. This module relies heavily on the factory_boy python package.

class ExtractionFactory[source]¶

Bases: factory.django.DjangoModelFactory

Creates an Extraction instance.

Mainly used for testing purposes. If no keyword arguments are provided, this class will generate the appropriate field values using the rules described in the attributes. For more information see: DjangoModelFactory.

Parameters:
  • aliquot (Aliquot) – The Extraction's parent model.
  • analyte (str) – See ANALYTE for choices.
  • ext_id (str) – ID used extrernally to track the Extraction.
Returns:

Extraction instance.

Examples:

# No arguments, attributes will be assigned randomly
extraction = ExtractionFactory()

# Passing specific values to specific attributes
extraction = ExtractionFactory(aliquot=AliquotFactory(), analyte='DNA')

Warning

Everytime ExtractionFactory is used without passing the aliquot attribute, a new Aliquot (and its parents Specimen and Individual) will be created.

aliquot = <factory.declarations.SubFactory object>¶

If not passed, creates a new Aliquot instance. To learn more see SubFactory.

analyte = <factory.fuzzy.FuzzyChoice object>¶

If not passed, picks a random choice from ANALYTE. To learn more see FuzzyChoice.

ext_id = <factory.fuzzy.FuzzyText object>¶

If not passed, creates a random ID. To learn more see FuzzyText.
